newsitem.title: UK: BAT, tobacco shares hit by new cancer-link study.
newsitem.headline: BAT, tobacco shares hit by new cancer-link study.

text.p: Tobacco industry shares were hit on Monday after U.S. scientists came up with new evidence to suggest a direct link between smoking and lung cancer.
Shares in BAT Industries and Imperial Tobacco fell in heavy early morning trade following the publication of the study in the prestigious Science journal on Friday.
BAT was down 6-1/2p at 423-1/2p and Imperial Tobacco was 1/2p lower at 378-1/2p.

Scientists at the city of Hope cancer centre in Duarte and the M.D. Anderson Cancer Center in Texas said they had identified a substance in the tar of cigarette smoke that directly transforms human lung tissue.
It is the first direct link on a cellular level between smoking and cancer.
